intro: Smilax labordei, commonly known as the Mexican catbriar, is a species of flowering plant in the family Smilacaceae. It is native to Mexico and is characterized by its woody, climbing stems and spiny nodes. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are typically clustered in umbels. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a waxy texture. Smilax labordei is often found in humid, shaded environments such as forests and thickets.
